title: Where should a 10th grade student learning math of astrophysics start? - Quora

response.answer_text: Don’t ever forget that you asked this question, and don’t ever forget the motivation you felt to ask it. The road is long, the hours tough, and the money’s not that fantastic. The temptations to do other, simpler, more rewarding things will be ever present. Your friends will want you to skip your studies, take a break, and share a Pepsi. Girls will try to get you to buy them necklaces instead of buy that new telescope you had your eye on….. Sounds austere…..? Well, maybe buy the odd necklace, the stars aren’t the only things worth looking at! Lots of advice will come from these pages, and from well-meaning friends and mentors… …remember your motivation, this, is the REAL DEAL, nothing can compare! Go for it, you CAN do it, don’t have doubts. Best wishes, rafe

If you're in the 10th grade and want to study Astrophysics later, I'd really advise you to focus on the basics of Physics and Maths. They really are important for a good research in Astrophsics. Otherwise, keep reading interesting books and keep asking questions and be curios! :)
